title: SQL Server -- 2016 Developer
description: Installs Sql Server 2016 Developer. If you plan on using Sysprep, you should instead install the "Preparation" and "Completion" steps.

sqlEdition.description: The possible values are: eval, dev, express

installType.description: The possible values are: normalInstall, prepareBeforeImage, completeAfterDeploy

admins.description: Comma-separated list of admins for the Sql Server instance and Analysis Services. Use "localMachine\Account" to use an account on the machine. (localMachine gets renamed to the proper computer name)

components.description: Put the same values as you would in FEATURES. The default is SQL (includes the SQL Server Database Engine, Replication, Fulltext, Data Quality Server and connectvity)

tabular.description: Installs Analysis Services in Tabular or Multidimensional mode

RServices.description: Installs R Services to the SQL Instance

polyBase.description: Installs PolyBase components. Java Runtime Environment (JRE) needs to be installed.

pid.description: If you want to register your eval version to a licensed version of SQL Server, you will need to end the Product ID Key (PID). The format is 00000-00000-00000-00000-00000.

runCommand.commandToExecute: [concat('powerShell.exe -ExectionPolicy bypass "& ''install-sql.ps1''" -sqlEdition ', parameters('sqlEdition'), ' -installType ', parameters('installType'), ' -components "',  parameters('components'), '" -instanceName',  parameters('instanceName'), ' -admins ',  parameters('admins'), ' -reporting:$', parameters('reporting'), ' -analysis:$', parameters('analysis'),  ' -tabular:$', parameters('tabular'), ' -integration:$',  parameters('integration') , ' -dataQualityClient:$', parameters('dataQualityClient'), ' -masterDataService:$', parameters('masterDataService'), ' -RServices:$', parameters('RServices'),  ' -polyBase:$', parameters('polyBase'),   '-pid "',  parameters('pid') ,'"'   )]
